nodes.bodyText: I would call this something different from calculate. calculate makes me think this is a transparently referential function, but because this can do a program.stackPop(), it's actually imperative. In fact, it almost always does a stackPop, it seems, except in two exceptional op codes. So it makes sense to me to call it something like popCallValue(), or even maybePopCallValue().

This function is not cohesive and the naming is unclear. It's doing two things, and one of them is validating and maybe throwing an exception. At the very least is should be called calculateAndValidateMinimumTransferGas
